abstract: A United States trade official said Monday that China’s government had not unfairly used a new anti-monopoly law to block a proposed deal by Coca-Cola.
snippet: A United States trade official said Monday that China’s government had not unfairly used a new anti-monopoly law to block a proposed deal by Coca-Cola.
lead_paragraph: A United States trade official suggested Monday that he thought the Chinese government acted in good faith when it blocked Coca-Cola’s bid to take over Chinese juice giant Huiyuan this year on antitrust grounds.

headline.main: China’s Coke Ruling Not Abusive, F.T.C. Official Says
